Class Sport

java.lang.Object
Sport
Direct Known Subclasses:
Baseball, Football, Hockey, Soccer
public abstract class Sport extends Object
Abstract class that represents a sport. This gives a common interface for each of the sports classes.

  • Method Details

    • setTeams

      protected void setTeams(Team homeTeam, Team awayTeam)
      Sets the teams that are in the game and initializes their scores to be 0.
      Parameters:
      homeTeam - The home team.
      awayTeam - The away team.

    • getTeams

      public Team[] getTeams()
      Returns the teams participating in a game.
      Returns:
      The array of teams.

    • getScores

      public int[] getScores()
      Returns the scores of the teams.
      Returns:
      The array of scores.

    • addScore

      public void addScore(ScoringMethod scoringMethod, Team team)
      Adds a score to a team.
      Parameters:
      scoringMethod - The scoring method.
      team - The team that scored.

    • determineScore

      protected abstract int determineScore(String scoringMethods)
      Determines the score to add based on the scoring method. Method is overridden by subclasses and implemented based on the scoring methods of each sport.
      Parameters:
      scoringMethods - The name of the scoring method.
      Returns:
      The score to add.

    • getWinningTeam

      protected Team getWinningTeam()
      Returns the winning team, if the game is over and there is a winner.
      Returns:
      The winning team, or null if the game is not over or there is a tie

    • getScoringMethods

      public List<ScoringMethod> getScoringMethods()
      Returns the scoring methods applicable to the sport.
      Returns:
      A list of scoring methods

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      Starts the game by setting the current period to 1.

    • endPeriod

      public void endPeriod()
      Ends the current period and advances to the next one.

    • getCurrentPeriod

      public int getCurrentPeriod()
      Returns the current period of the game.
      Returns:
      The current period

    • getPeriodName

      public String getPeriodName()
      Returns the name of the period.
      Returns:
      The period name

    • isGameOver

      public boolean isGameOver()
      Checks if the game is over, which is true if the current period is greater than 4.
      Returns:
      true if the game is over, false otherwise
